comment: She was very intersting...She Knows her stuff.. She asks you to use your brain a little bit and challenges you to think about art...Her test are easy if you study the book and lectures.  Don't talk or sleep though....

Very strange prof.  Easy A if you shut up and pay attention.  She has no class room management, she plays favorites, she grades you based on how she feels about you.  If you play the game this will be an easy A.  Just keep your head down and your mouth shut.  Tests are so easy, but you do have to look over the material.  I wouldn't do this again.

Professor Huang was a great teacher. she is very helpful and knew her material. she is a little hard to understand because of her accent but she tries to speak slowly and if you have a hard time understanding her she will make sure you do understand her. she also puts up all her lectures on Vista so we can study for exams. I would def. take her aga

Ok so maybe her class can be a bit boring because I had a three hr class so expected. She does try to make it interesting and make you understand art principles. I strongly believe that if you put effort in studying, then you should be able to make an A. This prof. is not as bad as people are saying
She doesnt change her dates fom monday wednesay to friday, so you never know when stuff is due. make sure you go to class and pay attention!

Not sure what everyone was complaining about!  She was not that hard to understand.  It's simple: pay attention, don't miss class,  and take notes (get notes from her if she is going too fast).  She is VERY fair, if you have a problem just talk to her.  Sit near the front and make sure she knows your name.  Fairly easy "A"; you just have to TRY!!!

She drove me and most of the class crazy. She is very difficult to understand because her accent is very strong and she is unclear on the assignments. She doesn't always take attendance but it is mandatory.

Ms. Huang is a nice person...but she is extremely unclear. She gives 20 question MC tests that cover 4 long chapters! She barely collects the pop quizzes. The only good thing about the class is you can make Cs on all of your tests, come to EVERY CLASS, and do well on everything else, you can still make an A. I got an A, but it was not easy at ALL.

She is very nice, but is pretty strict on attendance. She makes you do drawings which is pretty lame. The tests are very easy as well as the projects. Not a class I had to study for. I liked it for the most part. It did get boring at times. Its a straight forward class. She didn't use the book often, only to look up pictures as a visual.

She failed me once. Then was the only teacher offering it and I needed to do it again. She is just as bad but, now that I am not as lazy the class is not hard. It is hard to put up with as she is hard to follow, she treats students like we are 12. If you have any other option DO NOT TAKE this class. But KSU doesn't seem to have a problem with her.

By far the worst teacher of my college career. She is unclear about assignments, her broken english makes it difficult to understand what little relevant information she provides. The onmly saving grace to this class is that it was built to be an easy "A" so no teacher really can screw that up-though she came close

Although choices are limited, if you have another option, I would NOT suggest Huang's class.  Someone can sign you in if you're not there.  Her tests don't have much to do with her study guides, and her pop quizzes are BS - if you don't know the answer or are absent, you get a zero for the day!  Not much work, but boring.

Professor Huang is a terrible instructor. I took her Friday class which means I had to sit for 3 hours and listen to her babble in broken English about stuff that is irrelevant. She takes attendance in the last 5 minutes so you can't even leave early. And don't ask her for help, because she will not cooperate at all. Don't take this class!!

Professor Huang, is by far one of the worst professors at Kennesaw! She treats her students like their in high school. One day a student left her class eraly and she went running after him! She is not the most organized person and she dosen't explain assignments very well either. Class is mandatory and she drops a letter grade if you miss more than 3 days. Her study guides are useless and misleading. She also wasn't very helpful and never returned my emails. I did make a B in her class.

Easy class. Huang is often difficult to understand but gives really great notes. Tests are a joke! No worries if you hate studying. Assignments are rarely clear, but Huang is sweet and will help you out as much as he can. Don't let your class walk all over her and you will be just fine.
Easy enough class, but she can be hard to understand at times and EXTREMELY BORING. All you do is take notes and do a big group project. An easy grade for diligent students. Got a B and didn't study.

She is extremely unclear about what she wants on assignments and her study guides were not helpful at all. If you have a hard time understanding accents you may not always know what she is saying. Despite all of this, she is nice and helpful  however.

She was a good teacher. She's helpful & she loves what she teaches. Her tests r short (about 10-20 questions), so make sure u know the material or else u will have a 50/50 chance or a 1/4 chance since her exams r multiple choice & T/F. All of the test questions r from the notes she gives u though, so u should b fine if u pay attention & take notes.

This class can be summed up by the phrase "waste of time". she honestly doesn't know if she is coming or going. really easy grade, so no worries there but do not take this class if you want to learn anything about art, because you wont.

I had taken many art classes before this and knew a lot about history. I learned a lot more but my grade did not reflect the amount I learned in her class. She was a good teacher but the tests were impossible to predict what questions would be on them and the questions were about picky details and not about ideas and concepts discussed in class.
If you are someone who is well organized and likes clear directions on assignments, do not take this lady.  She is NOT helpful with ANYTHING.  Her tests are easy but questions are tricky and unclear.

Very vague teacher, half the time I had no idea what was going on in class, shes a nice lady and her tests arent bad if you study the book and look at her powerpoints.  I had to study a lot but i got an A

You'll appreciate art better after taking this class.  Difficult class for those who aren't art majors.  Tests are difficult because they stray from the study guide.  If you take the class and do the Chapter project, get competent people in your group.

She is very hard to understand.She will give you assignments and not tell you much about them.It is hard to keep up with everything that is due.Her tests are hard to understand sometimes because it is totally different from the study guide.However, she does give you a chance to get extra credit points.She has a pretty strict attendance policy.

Okay...she speaks english, but it's really broken up.  I gave up on staying awake in her class pretty much after the first week; you can pass her tests by reading the book and studying the pictures she posts on WebCt.  However, she's very helpful because so many people failed her tests and she would give redos and add on pts to your original score.

She is nice, but not clear about ANYTHING! She gives you alot of assignments, but doesn't tell you anything about them, and she forgets when things are due. The class is not hard, she just makes it hard to keep up. She  does have reviews for her tests, and they are not very hard anyways.
